fields.headline: Psion sells out to Nokia
fields.bodyText: "The purchase of Psion's 31% stake in Symbian, an operating system for 'smart' cell phones and handheld devices, will nearly double Nokia's interest to 63.3%. The transaction announced Monday calls for Psion, a London-based maker of mobile device software, to be paid 137 million euros ($172 million) plus 1.23 euros ($1.54) for each Symbian-based device sold during the next two years," reports the Mercury News
